h2.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Tahoma, Verdana, Arial, Helvetica; text-align: center;

p.style: box-sizing: border-box; margin: 0px 0px 10px; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-size: 14px; text-align: left;

div.p: An independent city of about 6,500 citizens, Buena Vista boasts a beautiful setting along the scenic Maury River in Rockbridge County, Virginia. Bounded on the east by the Blue Ridge Mountains, Buena Vista is home to Southern Virginia University as well as several small industries. Interstates I-81 and I-64 conveniently put Roanoke, Staunton, Harrisonburg, Waynesboro, and Charlottesville within an hour’s drive.

p.style: box-sizing: border-box; margin: 0px 0px 10px; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-size: 14px; text-align: left;

div.p: The Buena Vista City Public School Division includes a contemporary high school, a middle school, and two elementary schools. A total enrollment of approximately 1,040 students enables the faculty to provide personal attention and outstanding instruction. In January 2005, the State Department of Education recognized the system as a Distinguished Title I School Division.

p.style: box-sizing: border-box; margin: 0px 0px 10px; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-size: 14px; text-align: left;

div.p: It is the mission of Buena Vista City Public Schools to empower students to reach their fullest educational potentials, discover their strengths and develop visions for their futures.

p.style: box-sizing: border-box; margin: 0px 0px 10px; color: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-size: 14px; text-align: left;

div.p: Curricula and programs encompass core academic areas based on the Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools. All schools provide students with opportunities to participate in art, music, and physical education programs and have modern libraries and media centers. At the high school level, students may choose from general education, career and technical education majors, or advanced academic courses that carry college level, dual-enrollment credit.

span.strong:
Buena Vista School Board Suspends Search for Superintendent
Dr. John Keeler stays on as Division Superintendent

strong.span: Buena Vista City Schools Modified Fourth Quarter
F.W. Kling Jr Elementary School Learning Packet Information

p.br:
Your final learning packets will be available for pick up on Monday, April 20th between 8 - 3 and Tuesday between 8 - 3.
These packets do not need to be returned. However, there is a certification form in the packet we will need to be returned. You can mail it, drop it off in our mail box, or complete it online at this link once the work is completed.
If you have any questions about the work or need help with anything at all do not hesitate to call the school at 540-261-6717.
We will be adding more instructional videos this week and next so stay tuned! We miss everyone.

strong.span: Enderly Heights Elementary School Learning Packet Information

p.br:
Enderly will be handing out learning packets curbside April 20th between 9-11am and 1-3pm or will deliver, if families cannot pick up.
Teachers will be posting instructional videos of new material on their websites and on our Facebook page.
If parents or students have questions about their work, please contact the school or your child’s teacher.
This last learning packet will not be returned.
A certification statement from parents that this last learning packet was attempted/completed will be included in the packet and will need to be returned to the school either by mail or dropped off or you can use this link to certify that the work was done (by May 19th).

strong.span: Parry McCluer Middle School Learning Packet Information

p.br:
The final learning packet for PMMS may be picked up Monday, April 20 from 9 -11 am or 1-3 pm on the front porch of the school. Please return packet #2 when you pick up your final packet.
Grades of A, B, C, D, or F will not be assigned to the work. Remember, that all we are asking your child to do is to put forth his or her best effort. Also, remember that any computer work listed is optional.
Return learning packets to PMMS by May 18. We will be on the front porch of PMMS on May 18 to collect the packets. Parents inside the packet will be a form, which must be signed and returned, verifying that your child has completed the leaning packet. If you lose or misplace this form, click here for the online form.
THANK YOU for helping your child and PMMS to complete the 2019 -2020 school year.
May you and your family stay safe and well!
